Not only capturing the Pawn but attacking the Knight...
...forcing this recapture.
Hromadka immediately pressures the weak spot at KB7.
Lasker aims to win the advanced P at K5.
Hromadka counters with a pin.
Lasker removes the Knight threatening his own center Pawn.
Hromadka captures towards the center, preparing for P-Q4.
Lasker prepares to castle.
Hromadka follows up...
...as does Lasker.
With Lasker's K now on KN1, Hromadka repositions his B to aim that direction.
Creating a flight square.
Threatening QxP ch.
Cutting the B's diagonal.
Hromadka plays a drawing sacrifice...
...which Lasker accepts.
Forcing Black's response.
Without a piece to interpose on the second rank, Lasker has no choice.
Draw agreed. White has a perpetual check on KR6 and KN6.
